Name: Seleucids
History: The Macedonian-Greek dynasty that ruled most of Alexander's former empire.

Factions.Name: Seleucids
Factions.Description: The Macedonian-Greek dynasty that ruled the Eastern part of Alexander's former empire.

Technologies.Name: Cavalry Reform
Technologies.History: Antiochus III reformed his heavy cavalry adding extensive armor, impressed by eastern cataphracts during his campaigns to reclaim the northeast satrapies.

Technologies.Name: Infantry Reform
Technologies.History: Defeats by the Romans and Galatian influences lead the Seleucids to introduce a force of heavy swordsmen to the standing army.
Technologies.Description: Swordsmen +10% attack, hit points and speed, -10% train time.

Technologies.Name: Cleruchy
Technologies.History: The Seleucids attracted a large number of Greek, Macedonian, Thracian and other settlers, who were granted land around newly founded cities in return for military service.
Technologies.Description: All soldiers -10% resource cost and train time.

Technologies.Name: Silk Road
Technologies.Description: Traders and Cargo Ships -40% resource cost and train time.

Heroes.Name: Cataphract
Heroes.History: Unique Unit. Heavily Armored, Slow Moving Melee Cavalry. Deals x1.5 damage to Melee Infantry

CivBonuses.Name: Mesopotamia
CivBonuses.History: For almost two hundred years the Seleucids controlled the fertile region between the rivers Tigres and Ephrates.
CivBonuses.Description: Farms -20% wood cost and build time.

CivBonuses.Name: Nisean Horses
CivBonuses.History: The Seleucids had access to heavy Nisean Horses.

CivBonuses.Name: City Founders
CivBonuses.History: Even more so than other Successors, the Seleucids founded a huge number of cities, more often than not named Antiochia or Seleucia.
CivBonuses.Description: Civic Centers -15% resource cost and build time.

TeamBonuses.Name: Lords Of The East
TeamBonuses.History: Ruling over a large part of the eastern world, the Seleucids had access to a great number of warhorses.
